comments: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^(3[e/3]). - Mitch Harris, Apr 19 2005.
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Cubic Part
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^(3[e/3]).a(n) = A053150(n)^3. - _R. J. Mathar_, May 27 2011Dirichlet g.f. zeta(s)*zeta(3s-3)/zeta(3s). The Dirichlet convolution of this sequence with A050985 generates A000203. - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 05 2011
maple: with(numtheory): [ seq( expand(nthpow(i,3)),i=1..200) ];# alternative:A008834 := proc(n)    local p;    a := 1 ;    for p in ifactors(n)[2] do        e := floor(op(2,p)/3) ;        a := a*op(1,p)^(3*e) ;    end do:    a ;end proc:seq(A008834(n),n=1..40) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 08 2015
